Class SimulatePartitions

  • java.lang.Object
    • SimulatePartitions
  • public class SimulatePartitions
extends java.lang.Object
    Used throughout development to test how different partitions favour black or white, via simulations. Includes methods to generate and simulate partitions which are specified through I/O, various shapes such as L, O, U, lines and staircase, as well as a random partition generator method.

      • simulateGame

        public java.lang.Boolean simulateGame​(Board board,
                                      Player currentPlayer,
                                      java.util.ArrayList<Player> players)
        Simulates a game, for a given board object
        Parameters:
        board - Board object we want to simulate a game for
        currentPlayer - The first player to move
        players - List of both player objects
        Returns:
        Result of simulated game, true if white wins, false otherwise

      • simulatePartitionGames

        public int simulatePartitionGames​(int noOfSimulations,
                                  Board partition,
                                  int firstToMove,
                                  BoardPartitionSetup setup)
        Simulates a partition game a number of times, was used during development to test specific partitions
        Parameters:
        noOfSimulations - The number of simulations games that will be run
        partition - The partition board shape used for the simulation games
        firstToMove - Indicates which player will move first, 0 or 1
        setup - Stores the pieces and burnt squares information for the partition
        Returns:
        The number of times white wins

        Parameters:

      • generateCoordinates

        public void generateCoordinates​(BoardPartitionSetup setup,
                                java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> oldX,
                                java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> oldY,
                                java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> newX,
                                java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> newY)
        Generates a pair of co-ordinates, that aren't already being used.
        Parameters:
        setup - Partition setup information
        oldX - list of x co-ordinates being used
        oldY - list of y co-ordinates being used
        newX - unused square x co-ordinate
        newY - unused square y co-ordinate
